data.message: I about to leave Facebook because of the messenger app. It's ridiculous.

replies.message: We hear your frustration Dave and understand your concerns. You can learn more about app permissions at http://on.fb.me/1oYA84J. -Natalie
Facebook it's not about the permissions !!! It's about being forced to download another app for messaging when everybody in the world was very glad to have the messaging inside the FB app !!!

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/sam-fiorella/the-insidiousness-of-face_b_4365645.html?utm_hp_ref=tw+http%3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2FiA%2Fstatus%2F496185509916336130%2Fphoto%2F1%E2%80%9D What concerns me most, is the fact that the messenger app can "Modify phone state - Make calls without your intervention" and "An app can access your device ID(s), phone number, whether you're on the phone, and the number connected by a call." .. These are the main reasons I do not wish to use the Messenger App. It would be nice if Facebook could elaborate more on why exactly an app for messaging my facebook contacts should be able to make calls with me intervening?

Facebook, simple thing... please stop message notifications on Facebook app if you don't want us to receive messages on Facebook app. That's annoying. The notification can be turned off only for a limited time.
I'm upset about being forced to do something that I don't need, did not use before the new app appeared and then blocking what I really need to do.  How rude Facebook
Guys, when you go to facebook you don't have to download the messenger app for write to friends. You can't just click close on the messenger ads and BOOM!. So don't leave Facebook.

How to send messages without switching to the standalone messenger app:
If you're on android fones and happen to be rooted, use titanium backup or rom toolbox to freeze messenger...then clear data and cache for fb main app and you guys should be able to do your chats and pms inside fb
